title: Historical Data Downloader
description:
CLI tool to download futures market data at standard bar lengths.

## Goals
- Download OHLCV data for futures contracts
- Support standard bar sizes: 1, 5, 15, 30, 60 min
- Export to common formats (CSV, Parquet)
- Handle IB API pacing/rate limits

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Specify contract by Globex code or IB identifier
- [ ] Select bar size and date range
- [ ] Progress indication for long downloads
- [ ] Resume interrupted downloads
- [ ] Output to file with configurable format
close_reason: Historical data CLI complete with download, CSV/Parquet export

title: Add history CLI command scaffold
description: Add 'iborker history' command group with download subcommand
close_reason: Implemented history.py with fetch, CSV, and Parquet export

title: Implement historical data fetcher
description: Core logic to fetch OHLCV bars from IB with pacing handling
close_reason: Implemented history.py with fetch, CSV, and Parquet export

title: Add CSV/Parquet export
description: Export downloaded data to CSV and Parquet formats
close_reason: Implemented history.py with fetch, CSV, and Parquet export

title: Implement margin query for contracts
description:
Research and implement margin requirement lookup for futures contracts.

## Options to investigate:
1. **whatIfOrder** - Submit a simulated order to get margin impact
2. **reqAccountSummary** - Parse account data for margin info
3. **External data sources** - CME margin files, third-party APIs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Query initial margin for a given contract
- [ ] Query maintenance margin
- [ ] Handle cases where margin data unavailable

## Notes
IB doesn't expose margin directly via API. Need to work around this limitation.
close_reason: Implemented using whatIfOrder - iborker contract margin <symbol>

title: Set up src/iborker package structure
description:
Create the initial package layout:
- src/iborker/__init__.py
- src/iborker/cli.py (Typer app)
- src/iborker/connection.py (IB connection module)
- src/iborker/config.py (Pydantic settings)
- tests/ directory with conftest.py
close_reason: Package structure created with cli.py, config.py, connection.py, and tests/conftest.py

title: Options Stdev Analyzer
description:
Tool to analyze options market and determine expected price ranges.

## Goals
- Calculate 1σ/2σ/3σ price movement ranges from options IV
- Focus on futures options (ES, NQ, CL, etc.)
- Display probability-based price targets

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Fetch ATM options chain for specified futures
- [ ] Extract implied volatility
- [ ] Calculate expected move for configurable timeframes
- [ ] Display σ bands around current price
- [ ] CLI and/or simple GUI output

title: Fetch ATM options chain for futures contracts
description: Connect to IB and request options chain data for specified futures (ES, NQ, CL). Filter to get ATM strikes based on current underlying price.
close_reason: Implemented stdev.py module with fetch_options_chain() and chain CLI command

title: Extract implied volatility from options data
description: Parse options chain response and extract IV from ATM calls/puts. Handle IB's model volatility vs bid/ask IV.

title: Calculate expected move for configurable timeframes
description: Implement expected move formula: ExpectedMove = Price × IV × √(DTE/365). Support multiple timeframes (daily, weekly, to expiration).

title: Display sigma bands around current price
description: Calculate and display 1σ (68%), 2σ (95%), 3σ (99.7%) price ranges. Show upper/lower bounds for each band.

title: Build CLI interface for stdev analyzer
description: Create command-line interface accepting symbol, timeframe options. Format output clearly showing current price and all σ bands.

title: Contract Lookup Utility
description:
Utility to translate between exchange codes and IB identifiers.

## Goals
- Map Globex/exchange symbols to IB contract specs
- Query current futures margins
- Support common futures exchanges (CME, NYMEX, COMEX, etc.)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Lookup IB conId from Globex symbol (e.g., ES -> ESH5)
- [ ] Display contract details (multiplier, tick size, etc.)
- [ ] Show current margin requirements
- [ ] Cacheable/offline symbol database

## Notes
Nice-to-have feature - lower priority than core tools.
close_reason: Contract lookup complete with 34 symbols, IB lookup, local caching

title: Build Globex symbol database
description: Create mapping of common Globex symbols (ES, NQ, CL, GC, etc.) to IB contract specs
close_reason: Implemented contracts.py with 34 symbols and lookup CLI

title: Add contract lookup CLI command
description: iborker contract lookup <symbol> - show contract details, conId, multiplier, tick size
close_reason: Implemented contracts.py with 34 symbols and lookup CLI

title: Add margin query from IB
description: Query and display current margin requirements for contracts
close_reason: Stubbed out - IB lacks direct margin API, needs whatIfOrder implementation

title: Click Trader GUI
description:
Simple single-instrument GUI for quick order entry.

## Goals
- Lightweight GUI for rapid futures trading
- Single instrument focus (no multi-chart complexity)
- Quick actions: buy, sell, reverse, close

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Set number of contracts
- [ ] One-click buy/sell at market
- [ ] Reverse position (close + open opposite)
- [ ] Flatten/close all positions
- [ ] Display current position and P&L
- [ ] Configurable instrument selection
close_reason: Click Trader GUI complete with buy/sell/reverse/flatten, position and P&L display

title: Add DearPyGui dependency and trader module
description: Add dearpygui to deps, create src/iborker/trader.py with basic window
close_reason: Implemented trader.py with DearPyGui, position display, and IB order execution

title: Implement position display and order buttons
description: Show current position, P&L, and buy/sell/reverse/flatten buttons
close_reason: Implemented trader.py with DearPyGui, position display, and IB order execution

title: Wire up IB order execution
description: Connect buttons to IB order placement, handle fills and updates
close_reason: Implemented trader.py with DearPyGui, position display, and IB order execution

title: Shared IB Connection Module
description:
Foundational module for reusable TWS/Gateway connection and authentication logic.

## Goals
- Single connection management across all tools
- Configuration via environment/files (no hardcoded credentials)
- Async-first using ib_insync
- Connection health monitoring and reconnection

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Connect to TWS/Gateway with configurable host/port
- [ ] Handle authentication and connection lifecycle
- [ ] Expose async context manager for tools to use
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures
close_reason: Core connection module implemented with async context manager, Pydantic settings, and configurable host/port

title: Implement IB connection manager
description:
Core connection logic using ib_insync:
- Async context manager for IB connection
- Configurable host/port/client_id
- Connection state tracking
- Graceful disconnect handling

title: Add Pydantic settings for configuration
description:
Configuration management:
- TWS/Gateway host and port
- Client ID
- Account selection (for multi-account)
- Load from env vars and .env file
